articles.title: Greetings to founder-chairman of Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
Greetings to founder-chairman of Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea 
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea central committee on July 18 sent a message of greetings to Obiang Nguema Mbasogo upon his reelection as chairman of the democratic party of Equatorial Guinea at its 3rd congress.
 The message noted that his reelection is an expression of deep trust of all the party members and the people of Equatorial Guinea in him who is making energetic efforts for the development of the party and prosperity of the country.   
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work to consolidate independent development of the country and its political stability.

Newspaper reform called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Newspaper reform called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The societies against Chosun Ilbo of Seoul National University and four other universities and the Federation of University Newspaper reporters held a press conference on July 18 at which they issued the first declaration for the liquidation of conservative press including Chosun Ilbo and for newspaper reform, Seoul-based MBC reported.
 The organizations agreed to conduct a campaign not to read Chosun Ilbo, hold a rally exposing the reactionary nature of the newspaper and publish a declaration that they will not take employment at the newspaper office.    
 They opened to the public the list of 8,031 persons boycotting the newspaper.
